metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8777 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The process_envvars function in elf/rtld.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.23 allows local users to bypass a pointer-guarding protection mechanism via a zero value of the LD_POINTER_GUARD environment variable. Hector Marco and Ismael Ripoll discovered that the GNU C Library allowed the pointer-guarding protection mechanism to be disabled by honoring the LD_POINTER_GUARD environment variable across privilege boundaries. An local attacker could use this to exploit an existing vulnerability more easily.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8777` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-ppc64 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu1
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu1
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glibc package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu1').
